title: Mojo FAQ: Common Questions About Mojo Dialer & Leads
description: Mojo FAQ: Find answers to common questions about Mojo's lead generation tools and dialing system. Start selling smarter today.
content: Frequently Asked Questions About Mojo's Dialing and Lead SolutionsThe Most Popular Frequently Asked Mojo Dialer QuestionsGetting Started with Mojo What is Mojo and how does it work? Mojo is a premium Dialing System and Lead Generation platform that helps motivated salespeople quickly and efficiently target leads and make calls, while also taking advantage of full lead management. With our Quality lead offerings, Unique Dialing system and Reasonable Pricing; Mojo is considered the industry’s leading Power Dialer and Lead Generation services with a huge customer base! Do I need a CRM to use Mojo? No, you don’t need a separate CRM. Mojo includes a built-in Lead Manager that handles contact organization, notes, groups, and follow-up activities. Some users still choose to use Mojo alongside their CRM, but many rely on Mojo’s lead management tools as their complete solution. Can Mojo replace my existing CRM? Yes, in many cases. Mojo includes powerful lead organization, pipeline management, notes, call history, and activity tracking that allow many users to eliminate costly third-party CRM subscriptions. For users who still want to sync with an external CRM, Mojo offers integrations through custom integrations as well as third party connectors API Nation and Zapier. What industries is Mojo best suited for? While Mojo is widely used in real estate, its platform is equally valuable for any industry that relies on outbound prospecting. Insurance agents, financial advisors, home services, mortgage professionals, and many B2B sales teams successfully use Mojo to increase call volume, stay organized, and generate more appointments. Is Mojo only for real estate agents? No. While Mojo was originally built for real estate, insurance and mortgage professionals, today it's used by professionals in many industries who need an efficient way to contact leads, manage follow-ups, and stay organized with their sales pipeline. Pricing & Subscription How does Mojo pricing work? Mojo uses a month-to-month subscription model. You select the services you need, including Agent Access (required for each user), dialing licenses (single or triple line), and any lead data subscriptions you want to add. You can modify your plan at any time without long-term contracts or penalties Do I have to sign a long-term contract? No. All Mojo subscriptions are prepaid on a monthly basis. There are no long-term contracts or commitments. You have full control to, downgrade, or cancel as needed. Can I change or cancel my subscription anytime? Yes. You can make changes to your subscription at any time. Add or remove products, agents, or features as your business needs change. Downgrading to Agent Access only preserves your data so you don’t lose any information when making adjustments. How do I add or remove agents from my account? Adding an agent requires purchasing an additional Agent Access license. To remove an agent, you’ll first reduce your total Agent Access licenses in your subscription, which will prompt you to delete the agent record tied to that license. What happens to my data if I cancel or downgrade my subscription? When you downgrade to Agent Access only, your data remains in your account securely and for as long as your Agent Access is active. When you cancel, your data remains securely stored in your account for 90 days. After 90 days your account is purged and all contacts, calls, notes and purchased data is deleted. You can reactivate your account at anytime during the 90 days. Are there any hidden fees? No. Mojo’s pricing is fully transparent. You only pay for the products and data subscriptions you select. There are no hidden charges, setup fees, or cancellation penalties. Lead Data & List Services Where does Mojo get its data? Mojo partners with trusted data providers who supply public records, MLS data, consumer databases, and proprietary sources. This allows Mojo to offer highly targeted data sets such as expired listings, FSBO, FRBO, pre-foreclosures, and more. Is Mojo's lead data updated regularly? Yes. Mojo’s data subscriptions are updated on a frequent basis to ensure accuracy and freshness. The update frequency varies depending on the data set but generally occurs daily, weekly and monthly. Can I upload my own leads into Mojo? Yes. You can easily import your own lead lists into Mojo using CSV or Excel files. Once imported, you can call, organize, categorize, and track these leads inside Mojo’s Lead Manager. What’s the difference between Neighborhood Search, FSBO, FRBO, Expired, Pre-Foreclosure, and Skip Tracer? Neighborhood Search:Nationwide search tool to pull contact information based on geographic areas and property filters.FSBO (For Sale By Owner):Private homeowners selling without an agent.FRBO (For Rent By Owner):Owners renting property directly without property managers.Expired:Listings that did not sell before their listing contract expired.Pre-Foreclosure:Properties entering the foreclosure process.Skip Tracer:Appends additional contact information (phone numbers, emails, addresses) to incomplete lead records.Can I purchase leads for any area in the U.S.? Yes. Mojo offers nationwide access for Neighborhood Search and Skip Tracer. Other data sets like Expired, Pre-Foreclosure, FSBO, and FRBO are available by area, county, or state depending on your subscription. What is Skip Tracing and how does it work? Skip Tracing fills in missing contact information on your leads. Mojo’s integrated Skip Tracer searches public records and national databases to append phone numbers, email addresses, and mailing addresses to maximize your ability to connect with prospects. How Is Data Coverage Sold Nationwide Access: Neighborhood Search, Skip TracerBy County: For Sale By Owner (FSBO), For Rent By Owner (FRBO), Pre-Foreclosure DataBy Area: Expired DataDialer Features & Call Handling What is a power dialer? A power dialer automates outbound calls by dialing multiple prospects back-to-back, dramatically increasing the number of conversations you can have. Mojo’s power dialer minimizes idle time and automatically manages call connections, voicemails, and callbacks. The Mojo Dialer can operate as a click-to-call, single line and triple line power dialer. How many calls per hour can Mojo make? Mojo’s Triple Line Dialer can process up to 300 calls per hour depending on pickup rates and list quality. The Single Line Dialer offers a more traditional pace for focused prospecting and higher connection quality. What is the difference between single line and triple line dialing? Single Line Dialer:Calls one contact at a time for a personalized approach.Triple Line Dialer:Calls up to three contacts simultaneously to maximize call volume. The system automatically drops unanswered calls and connects you with live prospects.Does Mojo provide phone numbers or caller ID? Mojo offers local (personally owned or Mojo Caller ID) Caller ID management. You can purchase verified local phone numbers and have complimentary access to reputation management tools to reduce spam tagging. How does Mojo help avoid spam labels on Caller ID? Mojo provides complimentary whitelisting for all Caller IDs used on your account — whether you bring your own phone numbers or purchase Mojo Caller ID numbers. When using Mojo Caller ID, your calls are certified at Attestation Level A, the highest verification level available under STIR/SHAKEN standards, helping improve call delivery and reducing the risk of spam labeling. Can I record my calls? Yes. Mojo offers optional call recording features that allow you to automatically record calls for training, compliance, or reference purposes. Check local laws regarding consent for call recording. Can I use Mojo with my cell phone or desk phone? Yes. There are several ways you can connect to Mojo. This gives you options depending on your location and preferences. You can connect using your cell phone, desk phone or SIP Voice service by calling in to the server number displayed to y

title: General privacy policy | Mojo Dialer Blog
content: General privacy policy Last Updated: June 27, 2023 Introduction Mojo Dialing Solutions, LLC (“Mojo,” “we,” “us,” or “our”) respects your privacy and is committed to protecting it through our compliance with our general privacy policy (this “Privacy Policy”). This Privacy Policy describes the types of information we may collect from you or that you may provide when you visit our website or mobile applications (collectively, our “Website”) and our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting, and disclosing that information. This Privacy Policy applies to information we collect: On this Website. In e-mail, text, and other electronic messages between you and this Website. Through our mobile and desktop applications, which provide dedicated non-browser-based interaction between you and this Website. When you interact with our advertising and applications on third-party websites and services, if those applications or advertising include links to this policy. This Privacy Policy does not apply to information collected by: Us, offline or through any other means, including on any other website operated by Mojo or any third party; or Any third party, including through any application or content (including advertising) that may link to or be accessible from or on our Website. Please read this Privacy Policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your information and how we will treat it. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, your choice is not to use our Website. By accessing or using this Website, you agree to this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy may change from time to time (see Changes to Our Privacy Policy). Your continued use of our Website after we make changes is deemed to be acceptance of those changes, so please check this Privacy Policy periodically for updates. Children Under the Age of 16 Our Website is not intended for children under 16 years of age. No one under age 16 may provide any information to or on our Website. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 16. If you are under 16, do not use or provide any information on this Website or on or through any of its features. If we learn we have collected or received personal information from a child under 16 without verification of parental consent, we will delete that information. If you believe we might have any information from or about a child under 16, please contact us at privacy@mojosells.com. California residents under 16 years of age may have additional rights regarding the collection and sale of their personal information. Please see Your State Privacy Rights for more information. Information We Collect About You and How We Collect It We collect several types of information from and about users of our Website, including information: By which you may be personally identified, such as name, postal address, e-mail address, telephone number, or any other identifier by which you may be contacted online or offline (“Personal Information“); That is about you but individually does not identify you; and/or About your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Website, and usage details. We collect this information: (A) directly from you when you provide it to us; (B) automatically as you navigate through our Website (information collected automatically may include usage details, IP addresses, and information collected through cookies and other tracking technologies); and/or (C) from third parties, for example, our business partners. Information You Provide to Us The information we collect on or through our Website may include: Information that you provide by filling in forms on our Website. For example, information provided at the time of registering to use our Website, subscribing to our service, or requesting further services. We may also ask you for information when you report a problem with our Website. Records and copies of your correspondence (including e-mail addresses), if you contact us. Your responses to surveys that we might ask you to complete for research purposes. Details of transactions you carry out through our Website and of the fulfillment of your orders. For example, you may be required to provide financial information before placing an order through our Website. Information We Collect Through Automatic Data Collection Technologies As you navigate through and interact with our Website, we may use “cookies” and other automatic data collection technologies to collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions, and patterns. A “cookie” is a small piece of data stored by your browser and used by web servers to remember your browser over time, including preferences and other information. Information we collect through automatic data collection technologies may include: Details of your visits to our Website, including traffic data, location data, and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Website. Information about your computer and internet connection, such as your IP address, operating system, and browser type. The information we collect automatically may include personal information. This information helps us improve our Website and deliver a better and more personalized online experience by enabling us to: Estimate our audience size and usage patterns. Store information about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Website according to your individual interests. Recognize you when you return to our Website. You may refuse to accept browser cookies by activating the appropriate setting on your browser. However, if you configure your browser to reject cookies, you may disable some of the features of our online services. Unless you adjust your browser settings to refuse cookies, our system will issue cookies when you direct your browser to our Website. Third-Party Use of Cookies and Other Tracking Technologies Some content or applications on our Website are provided by third-parties, such as our business partners, which may use cookies alone or in conjunction with other tracking technologies to collect information about you when you use our Website. The information they collect may be associated with your personal information or they may collect information, including personal information, about your online activities over time and across different websites and other online services. They may use this information to provide you with interest-based (behavioral) advertising or other targeted content. We do not control these third parties’ tracking technologies or how they may be used. If you have any questions about an advertisement or other targeted content, you should contact the responsible provider directly. For information about how you can opt out of receiving targeted advertising from many providers, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information. How We Use Your Information We use information that we collect about you or that you provide to us, including any personal information: To present our Website and its contents to you. To provide you with information, products, or services that you request from us. To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it. To provide you with notices about your account, including expiration and renewal notices. To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including for billing and collection. To notify you about changes to our Website or any products or services we offer or provide though it. In any other way we may describe when you provide the information. For any other purpose with your consent. We may also use your information to contact you about products and services that may be of interest to you. If you do not want us to use your information in this way, please contact us at privacy@mojosells.com. For more information, see Choices About How We Use and Disclose Your Information. title: Circle Prospecting for Listings: Practical Lead‑Generation Strategies for Agents
description: Introduction to Circle Prospecting for Real Estate agents looking for high ROI real estate lead generation methods.
content: Converting Neighbors to Listings Circle prospecting is a repeatable, neighborhood-first approach that helps agents find leads and build local credibility. This guide breaks down what circle prospecting is, why it works, and how to make it part of your regular lead-gen routine. You’ll learn how to pick target areas, assemble and prioritize lists, run outreach that converts, and layer in advanced tactics. If finding steady, high-quality leads and owning a local market feels hard, circle prospecting gives you a structured way to connect with motivated sellers in your community. What is Circle Prospecting in Real Estate and Why Does It Work? Circle prospecting is a focused real estate lead generation method where you contact homeowners inside a defined area to surface potential sellers. It’s effective because it leverages your neighborhood knowledge and repeated, local touches to build trust. When you consistently show up around the same streets and names, you become the obvious choice when someone decides to sell. Definition and Core Principles of Circle Prospecting At its core, circle prospecting means systematically contacting homeowners in a targeted radius or neighborhood. The core principles are simple: know the market, open friendly conversations, document every contact, and follow up on a schedule. Done well, it positions you as the go-to local expert and keeps your pipeline full. Benefits of Circle Prospecting for Real Estate Agents Circle prospecting delivers several clear benefits: it pulls leads directly from your desired area, strengthens referral pathways, and helps you earn repeat business. It also boosts your local visibility and reputation. Conversion rates vary by market and consistency, but agents who treat circle prospecting as a disciplined habit report steady improvements and success at a much higher ROI than other real estate lead generation methods. How to Define Your Target Area and Build Effective Lead Lists Mojo’s Neighborhood Search Choosing the right target area is the foundation of successful circle prospecting. Tools like the Mojo Dialer and Neighborhood Search let you draw neighborhoods, filter properties, and export focused lead lists so your outreach is precise and manageable. Below are practical ways to build lists that turn into conversations. Using Neighborhood Search to Identify Potential Sellers Use neighborhood search in your dialer to filter by ownership length, property type, equity and ALM turnover indicators. The tighter and more specific your area, the easier it is to build familiarity and trust. Leveraging Data Products: Expired, FSBO, and Pre-Foreclosure Leads Layer expired listings, FSBOs, and pre-foreclosure records into your neighborhood lists to surface motivated sellers. These data products point you to homeowners already engaged with the idea of selling – so you spend effort where it pays off most. What Are the Best Scripts and Outreach Methods for Circle Prospecting? How you start the conversation determines whether it becomes a lead. This section shares proven scripts and outreach channels from industry leaders that help you move from a first touch to a meeting or a listing opportunity. Crafting Compelling Circle Prospecting Scripts for Calls Keep scripts short, helpful, and neighborhood-focused. A working example: “Hi, I’m [Your Name] with [Your Company]. I’m checking in on recent sales around [Street/Area], would you like a quick idea of what your home could sell for today?” That opening is friendly, relevant, and asks a low‑commitment question. Practice these lines until they sound natural; role-play improves confidence and results. Real Estate Agent Script Practice for Sales Success Make script practice a regular habit. Role-playing reduces hesitation and sharpens responses to common objections, small preparation, big difference. Executing Outreach: Calls, Door-Knocking, and Digital Strategies with Mojo Dialer Mix phone outreach, door-knocking, and digital touches for a multi-channel approach. Mojo Dialer speeds up calling and follow-up workflows, while Mojo’s Door Knocker app streamlines contact tracking and strategic follow-up. Targeted email sent with the Mojo Dialer keeps your name in front of the neighborhood between calls. Multiple, consistent touch points increase the chance of converting a conversation into a listing. How to Master Follow-Up and Lead Nurturing with Real Estate CRMs Follow-up separates busy agents from successful ones. This section covers CRM routines and nurturing techniques that keep leads moving toward a listing decision. Integrating Mojo Dialer’s Lead Management for Effective Follow-Up Mojo Dialer’s lead management tools help you log calls, set follow-up reminders, and tag leads by readiness. Use customized statuses and scheduled callbacks so no promising conversation slips through the cracks. Best Practices for Increasing Lead Conversion Rates To convert more leads, personalize outreach, deliver timely market updates, and offer value up front, like free home evaluations or local market reports. Regular, helpful contact keeps you top of mind when a homeowner decides it’s time to sell. Combining Circle Prospecting with Other Lead Generation Methods Don’t rely on one channel. Pair circle prospecting with targeted ads, content that showcases local expertise, and open-house follow-ups to capture leads across multiple touch points. A blended approach widens your funnel and reinforces your neighborhood presence. Ensuring Compliance and Handling Objections in Prospecting Calls Always follow telemarketing rules (including the National Do Not Call Registry and state-specific regulations) to avoid fines and preserve reputation. When you meet objections, listen, empathize, and offer a small next step, like sending a short market snapshot, so the conversation can continue without pressure. How to Measure and Optimize Your Circle Prospecting Results Tracking results lets you refine targeting, scripts, and cadence. One Mojo Dialer feature that makes goal tracking and measuring easily possible is the Prospecting Dashboard. You can measure and adjust based on your goals and how you are tracking to reach them. Key Performance Indicators for Circle Prospecting Success Monitor metrics such as leads generated, contact rate, appointments set, and listings secured. Also track follow-up adherence and conversion by lead source. Review these KPIs weekly and adjust targeting or messaging based on what the data shows. Overcoming Common Challenges and Real-World Success Stories with Mojo Dialer Common obstacles include time constraints and inconsistent lead quality. Agents using Mojo Dialer often report greater efficiency and clearer follow-up systems. When technology is paired with disciplined outreach, it’s easier to win more listings from circle prospecting. Circle prospecting is a practical, local-first strategy that rewards consistency. Use the steps here, define tight target areas, build prioritized lists, practice concise scripts, and follow up reliably – and you’ll steadily increase listings and referrals in your chosen neighborhoods. Triple line dialing increases dials per hour, while CRM capabilities organize and prioritize leads automatically. Call recording and KPI dashboards deliver performance feedback, fueling continuous improvement and higher contact rates.How Does the Triple Line Dialer Increase Call Volume and Agent Productivity?The Triple Line Dialer dials three prospects at once and connects agents only when calls are answered, cutting idle time and increasing successful connects. By automating number sequencing and drop-off detection, agents avoid manual dialing delays and maximize talk time. For example, an agent making 50 manual calls per hour can escalate to over 150 live connects with triple-line technology, directly impacting appointment scheduling rates.Agents experience consistent call pacing and reduced downtime, which leads to predictable hourly outputs. Understanding call patterns through integrated session reports helps refine lead list segments for higher conversion probabilities, creating a cycle of continuous improvement in outreach effectiveness.What CRM Capabilities Are Integrated into Mojo Dialer for Lead Management?Mojo Dialer’s CRM functionality captures contact details, call outcomes, and follow-up tasks in a unified interface, eliminating the need for external spreadsheets or third-party tools. Every call outcome, left voicemail, interested, not interested – is logged automatically, triggering next-step reminders or drip sequences without manual intervention. This mechanism ensures no lead falls through the cracks and supports more personalized outreach.The embedded Prospecting Dashboard displays agents key performance indicators so manager, team leaders and agents can set goals and visualize progress. Centralized data entry frees agents to focus on conversations rather than administration, delivering faster speed-to-lead and better relationship building across large prospect lists.How Do Call Analytics Improve Real Estate Agent Performance?Built-in analytics aggregate metrics like average talk time, connect rate, and drop rate, providing transparent KPIs for individual and team performance. Agents identify high-impact scripts by reviewing top-performing calls, then replicate winning language across the organization.How Does Mojo Dialer Streamline Cold Calling for Real Estate Agents?Mojo Dialer streamlines cold calling by automating dialing logic, populating your lead sheet questionnaires, and simplifying note and call tracking to ensure agents remain in conversation mode rather than administrative mode. This end-to-end process keeps agents focused on meaningful dialogues and maximizes hourly reach.What Are Effective Real Estate Cold Calling Scripts to Use with Mojo Dialer?“Hi [Name], this is [Agent] with [Brokerage]. Would a quick chat about your home’s current market value be helpful?”Structured openings like these guide agents toward appointment-setting, and built-in outcome groups in Mojo Dialer categorize responses for next-step automation.It’s important to have well-crafted scripts ready for various scenarios when engaging in warm and cold outreach.How Can Agents Overcome Common Objections During Cold Calls?Price Objections: “I understand your hesitation. May I share how we achieve that for sellers like you?”What Best Practices Maximize Success in Real Estate Cold Calling?Segment lists by lead type (expired, FSBO, referral), then tailor scripts accordingly.Schedule dialing sessions for peak answer hours, typically early mornings and late afternoons.Review any call recordings weekly to refine tone, pacing, and objection responses.Automate next-step reminders for callbacks within 24 hours using Mojo Dialer’s follow-up features.Analyze session reports to reallocate efforts toward high-yield segments.Applying these practices within Mojo Dialer’s structured workflows ensures sustained efficiency and enhanced contact rates.How Does Mojo Dialer Support Lead Generation and Management for Real Estate Agents?Mojo Dialer supports lead generation by integrating prospect lists, automating initial outreach, and maintaining continuous engagement through CRM-driven workflows. title: Avoid Spam Likely Tags: Real Estate Calling Tips from Mojo
description: Avoid
content: Best Practices for Telemarketers and Real Estate ProspectorIn today’s highly regulated telecom environment, few things can derail a sales campaign faster than your outbound calls being labeled “Spam Likely.” Whether you’re cold calling FSBOs, circle prospecting neighborhoods, or nurturing expired listings, getting your call answered is the first and most critical step.At Mojo Dialing Solutions, we understand how essential consistent contact rates are for real estate professionals and sales teams. That’s why we’ve built powerful tools into the Mojo Dialer to help mitigate spam tagging, protect your caller reputation, and keep your conversations flowing.Here’s what you need to know about avoiding spam tagging, and how Mojo helps you stay ahead of the curve.What Causes “Spam Likely” Tags?Carriers and third-party analytics companies are increasingly using algorithms to flag suspicious or spammy call behavior. While this is great for protecting consumers, it can mistakenly flag legitimate prospecting calls, especially when outbound calling is a key part of your strategy.Common triggers for spam tagging include:High volume of outbound calls from the same Caller ID in a short periodLow answer rates or frequent hang-upsLack of Caller ID branding or CNAM registrationUnregistered or unverified numbers lacking STIR/SHAKEN attestationBest Practices to Avoid Spam TaggingManaging your calling reputation is not a one-time task, it’s an ongoing strategy. Here are proven practices to reduce your chances of being flagged:Rotate Your Caller IDs StrategicallyAvoid overusing a single Caller ID. Mojo allows you to rotate and assign different Caller IDs by campaign or call session, helping spread out call volume and reduce the risk of tagging.Register Your Caller IDs (CNAM)CNAM registration allows you to display a branded Caller ID name, giving recipients confidence that your call is legitimate. Mojo’s Virtual Phone Numbers come CNAM-ready, giving your calls instant credibility that many competitors don’t offer.Acheive STIR/SHAKEN Attestation AOutbound calls made with our Mojo Caller ID’s are registered with Attestation A, the highest level of caller verification under the STIR/SHAKEN protocol. This tells carriers that the call originated from a verified source, improving your reputation and reducing false tagging. While Mojo Caller ID’s are unique in this way, any Mojo user can bring their own caller ID’s with them and have us whitelist them, free of charge.Maintain High Answer and Engagement RatesPoor answer rates or hang-ups can signal spam behavior. Ensure you’re calling qualified leads, using clean lists, and fine-tuning your scripts for better engagement.Bring Your Own Numbers (Optional)Prefer to use your own Caller IDs? Mojo gives you full control. You can bring your own number, whitelist it through our platform, and still benefit from our Spam Tag Mitigation and CNAM services.Mojo’s Built-In Tools for Caller ID Reputation ManagementMojo Dialing Solutions takes caller ID management seriously. Here’s how we help you maintain clean numbers and maximize answer rates:Spam Tagging Mitigation & MonitoringWe actively monitor for spam tagging and take action to minimize disruptions. If your number is flagged, our team helps initiate the appeal and remediation process with carriers and data sources to clear the tag quickly.Virtual Phone Numbers with Branded Caller IDEvery Mojo Virtual Number is equipped with CNAM registration and Attestation A support, giving you an edge in deliverability and trust. These are not generic virtual numbers like you’ll find elsewhere, they’re fully verified and optimized for professional prospecting.Campaign-Based Caller ID ControlWhether you’re running expired listings on Monday and FSBOs on Friday, Mojo lets you assign unique Caller IDs to each campaign. This keeps your numbers fresh and limits overexposure.Flexible Caller ID OptionsChoose the strategy that works best for your business. Mojo supports:Mojo-issued Virtual Numbers (Mojo Caller ID)Branded CNAM supportBring-Your-Own-Number configurationFull Caller ID Campaign ControlMojo’s Free Whitelisting Service: Protect Your Caller ID at the SourceMojo’s Whitelisting Service is a powerful, behind-the-scenes tool designed to safeguard your Caller ID reputation across major telecommunications networks. Offered completely free of charge, this service registers your Caller ID with leading carriers and third-party call analytics providers to help prevent unwanted “Spam Likely” tagging before it starts. We actively monitor for spam flags, and if a number does get tagged, our team immediately begins the appeal process to restore your number’s reputation quickly. In addition, we brand your Caller ID (when supported by the carrier) to increase recognition and trust, leading to more valuable conversations and higher answer rates. It’s one more way Mojo gives you enterprise-grade tools without the enterprise-grade hassle.What Not to Do: Avoid “Snowshoeing” and Caller‑ID Cycling Without StrategySome dialing platforms or third‑party “virtual number pools” employ a technique known as snowshoeing- rapidly cycling through a large inventory of unowned or generic numbers to spread out call volume, evade rate limits, and avoid detection. While this might seem like a clever hack for higher throughput, it is widely regarded as a spamming technique.Here’s why you should avoid snowshoeing:Carrier and analytics systems flag it as suspicious behavior. Traffic spread across many unused or unbranded numbers tends to appear like mass‑mail spam, often triggering automatic “Spam Likely” or “Scam” labels – or even outright blocking. It undermines long-term deliverability and reputation. Instead of building credibility, snowshoeing erodes trust. Carriers may penalize or blacklist entire number pools, which could affect future campaigns. Industry experts warn that snowshoeing jeopardizes brand identity and outbound success. In short: while rotating numbers can be a legitimate strategy if done right (with owned IDs, CNAM, and proper attestation), “spinning” through anonymous or unbranded numbers purely to avoid caller‑ID limits, like many auto dialer platforms have resorted to, is counterproductive and risky. That’s why at Mojo we advocate for managed, transparent Caller‑ID rotation-not snowshoeing.Why This Matters for Real Estate ProspectingYour phone is still your most powerful sales tool, especially in real estate, where speed-to-lead and direct conversations make the difference between a lost opportunity and a closed deal. With so many dialers on the market, it’s tempting to look only at pricing or features. But ignoring your caller ID reputation can torpedo your efforts.Mojo’s all-in-one Real Estate Dialer is not just about call volume, it’s about call quality, deliverability, and reputation. We’re constantly evolving to keep you compliant and competitive.Final Thoughts: Protect Your Reputation, Protect Your PipelineGetting your call answered is no longer as simple as hitting “dial.” Carrier networks, spam filters, and consumer call screening tools are changing the rules. But with the right tools and practices, you can stay ahead.Mojo Selling Solutions offers a full suite of caller ID reputation tools, from CNAM branding and virtual numbers to spam mitigation and whitelisting support – helping you maximize contact rates and keep your pipeline productive.Stay verified.Stay branded.Stay connected.Ready to clean up your caller ID and have more valuable conversations?Sign up today and experience the Mojo advantage. content: Every year around Thanksgiving, we talk to agents who tell us they’re taking it easy until January. Nothing really happens in the Fall anyway, right?Wrong. Those same agents scramble to catch up while consistent agents are already contracting spring real estate listings and filling their calendars with closings.Real estate success isn’t built in the moment – it’s built months in advance. If you want a strong start to 2026, smart prospecting starts now for spring real estate listings.Why Q4 Is the Time to Become the Celebrity in the HouseholdMost agents disappear right when homeowners are ready to have real conversations. The holidays trigger reflection: “Do we need more space?” “Should we downsize?” “Wouldn’t it be nice to be in a new place by next summer?”If you’re staying in contact, you’re the name they remember when it’s time to act.What the Market Is Telling UsInterest rates are showing signs of improvement. Earlier this year, 30-year mortgage rates peaked above 7%. As of late September, they’ve dropped to around 6.3-6.5%. That’s enough to turn “maybe later” sellers into “let’s explore our options” sellers.Low inventory still gives sellers a significant advantage in most markets. Despite inventory being up roughly 20% year-over-year, we’re still running 20-30% below normal levels. Your job is showing sellers this opportunity and finding those clients before someone else does.Stay Top-of-Mind by Being Everywhere They LookThe most successful agents stay connected, visible, and top-of-mind when everyone else checks out. title: Mojo Voice: The Future of Mojo Dialer Calls
description: Mojo Voice: Experience the future of Mojo Dialer calls! Get exceptional quality and seamless integration to power your prospecting.
content: After nearly 18 years with Mojo Selling Solutions, it’s rare that I get this excited about a new product feature. Over the years, we’ve introduced powerful upgrades to the Mojo Dialer to help real estate agents and sales professionals prospect smarter and close more deals. But today, I’m thrilled to announce a major leap forward in how our clients connect to the Mojo system – Mojo Voice.We’re proud to introduce Mojo Voice, a SIP connector that provides a dedicated, browser-based voice connection to the Mojo Dialer servers – no office phone, mobile phone, or third-party app needed.If you’re already using the Mojo Dialer, you know we’re laser focused on performance, reliability, and simplicity. Mojo Voice checks all those boxes, and then some.Unlocking the Power of Mojo Voice: A Seamless SIP IntegrationMojo Voice is a seamless, SIP-based connection built directly into the Mojo Dialer interface. It allows agents to connect to the Mojo servers directly through their browser without having to rely on a landline or cell phone.That means one less device. One less distraction. One more reason to love using Mojo.Unlike other auto-dialer systems that rely on generic VoIP calling, the Mojo Dialer will continue to maintain our analog telephony architecture – even when Mojo Voice is used to connect. Why This Is a Big Deal for AgentsWhether you’re calling from a bustling real estate office or prospecting from a quiet home workspace, Mojo adapts to your environment. We designed this new feature with flexibility, performance, and simplicity in mind.Let’s break it down:Easy to Use: Mojo Voice lives right inside the Mojo Dialer. There’s no need to install third-party softphones, configure complicated SIP settings, or toggle between devices. You simply log in and start dialing.Exceptional Call Quality: Because Mojo Voice uses a proprietary closed network, clients can expect crisp, reliable connections. It’s not just comparable to traditional landlines—it may actually sound better, especially if you’re used to the inconsistencies of VoIP or mobile calls.Cost-Effective: At just $30 per agent per month, Mojo Voice offers unmatched value. You get a high-quality SIP connection that integrates directly with your Mojo Dialer workflow, without having to rely on external service providers.Perfect for Remote and Hybrid Teams: In today’s flexible work world, Mojo Voice keeps your agents productive no matter where they’re located. Whether your team is in the office, at home, or on the road, Mojo Voice ensures a consistent and professional prospecting experience.Seamless Integration with the Mojo DialerMojo Voice represents a natural evolution of our platform. We’ve always aimed to reduce friction and improve productivity for agents who rely on Mojo as their real estate dialer of choice. With Mojo Voice, we’re streamlining one of the final pieces of the calling experience – the actual dialer connection.Agents no longer have to juggle their mobile phone or office line alongside the dialer. Mojo Voice simplifies everything into a single, unified interface.This means fewer missed calls, fewer setup issues, and more time spent talking to prospects.Mojo Voice + Mojo Dialer = More ConversationsAt Mojo Selling Solutions, we’ve always believed that the magic happens when agents are in live conversations with real people. Mojo Voice helps you get there faster and more efficiently.When combined with our Power Dialer, advanced CRM Dialer tools, and Real Estate Lead Generation data and integrations, Mojo Voice becomes a critical component in maximizing your daily outreach and results.Whether you’re dialing through FSBOs, Expireds, or your SOI, Mojo Voice ensures you sound your best—every single time.Final Thoughts from the Mojo TeamAdding a SIP connector to our platform has been one of the most requested features from our clients over the years. We wanted to do it right – Mojo Voice is the result of that patience and engineering focus.We believe Mojo Voice will transform the way you use the Mojo Dialer – especially for teams with remote agents, hybrid offices, or anyone looking to ditch the hassle of managing separate devices.As someone who’s been part of the Mojo journey from the beginning, I can honestly say this is one of the most exciting updates we’ve ever made.If you’re already a Mojo user, Mojo Voice is going to feel like second nature. If you’re new to our platform and looking for a professional, scalable auto dialer with premium voice quality, this is the perfect time to jump in.To get started or learn more, visit www.mojosells.com or head over to our sign-up page.We’re proud to keep innovating and supporting the sales professionals who trust Mojo to grow their business. Keep your ear to the ground, we’ve got more cool stuff coming your way. title: Mojo Dialer: Top 10 List Rules for Sales Automation in 2025
description: Mojo Dialer: Discover the top 10 list rules to automate your sales in 2025. Improve lead management and follow-up for sales success.
content: Uncover the Mojo Dialer List Rules Powering Top Sales TeamsSales success hinges on efficiency. Every minute spent on manual lead management is a minute not spent closing deals. That’s why the most successful sales and real estate agents using Mojo Dialer have embraced list rules – automated “if this, then that” commands that streamline their prospecting workflow.After reviewing hundreds of client configurations, we’ve identified the 10 most popular list rules that are transforming how top performers manage their sales pipeline. These automation triggers eliminate repetitive tasks, ensure no lead falls through the cracks, and keep agents focused on what matters most: connecting with prospects and closing deals.What Are List Rules?List rules are intelligent automation commands that monitor your contacts and trigger specific actions based on predefined conditions. Think of them as your personal assistant that never sleeps, constantly organizing your database and moving prospects through your sales funnel based on their behavior and your calling activity.The Top 10 List Rules Every Sales Professional Should Use1. Call Attempt Threshold Management“If call attempts equals ‘X’, then move to list/group”This rule prevents you from burning time on unresponsive leads. Set a maximum number of attempts (typically 6-8 calls) before automatically moving contacts to a different list, perhaps a “long-term nurture” group or “quarterly follow-up” list. This keeps your active calling list fresh and focused on connecting with responsive prospects.2. Call Result-Based List Movement“If call result equals ‘X’, then move contact to list/group”Automatically sort contacts based on call outcomes. When someone says “you’ve got the wrong number,” use the Bad Number call result and they’re instantly moved out of the current list and put in a list to be dealt with later. Left a voicemail? They go to your voicemail follow-up sequence. This ensures every contact receives appropriate follow-up without manual sorting.3. Action Plan Triggers“If call result equals ‘X’, then trigger action plan”Launch predetermined sequences based on call results. When a prospect shows interest, automatically trigger your “warm lead nurture” sequence with scheduled calls, emails, and tasks. This ensures consistent follow-up that matches prospect engagement levels.4. Database Cleanup Automation“If call result equals ‘X’, then archive contact”“if call attempts equal ‘X’, then archive contact”Automatically archive contacts who’ve explicitly opted out, moved, or are no longer relevant. This keeps your active database clean and focused on viable prospects while maintaining records for compliance.5. Time-Based List Management“If contact create date is older than ‘X’, move to list/group”Prevent leads from going stale by automatically moving older contacts to different nurture sequences. Contacts older than 90 days might move to a “re-engagement” campaign, while year-old leads shift to annual check-ins.6. Email Engagement Triggers“If email opened, move to list/group”“If email opened, create follow-up call”Email opens indicate renewed interest. This rule automatically moves email-engaged contacts to your “hot leads” list for immediate calling, capitalizing on demonstrated interest when it’s strongest. Or, for more targeted follow-up, create list rules that create specific follow up calls on your calendar when the lead opens your email. 7. Fresh Start Reset“If contact moved to group, reset calling attempts to 0”When contacts move between lists (like from cold to warm leads), reset their call attempt counter. This prevents prematurely retiring contacts who may now be more receptive due to changed circumstances. Also, many power prospectors argue a truer way of gauging lead engagement is by resetting calling attempts after each contact.8. Task Creation Automation“If contact moved to group, create task”Automatically generate specific tasks when contacts change lists. Moving someone to “Hot Lead” might create a task to “send follow-up email” or “schedule appointment,” ensuring no follow-up action is forgotten.9. Follow-Up Call Scheduling“If email opened, schedule follow-up call”“If moved to group, schedule follow-up call”Convert email engagement into phone conversations by automatically scheduling follow-up calls when emails are opened. This bridges the gap between digital engagement and personal connection.10. Market Change Responsiveness“If listing status change is older than ‘X’, move to list/group”For real estate agents, this rule monitors property listing changes and automatically moves contacts to appropriate lists. Expired listings older than 30 days might move to “Expired B” while expired listings older than 60 days might move to “Expired C”. This way, agents can focus their attention on newer listings with a more frequent outreach cadence, while slowing down their outreach cadence with Expired B and C leads.This type of workflow is extremely common throughout the Mojo environment and across many industries.The Bottom Line: Work Smarter, Not HarderThese list rules transform chaotic lead management into a streamlined, automated system. Top-performing agents report saving 3-4 hours weekly on data management tasks while improving follow-up consistency and conversion rates.The beauty of list rules lies in their customization. Each rule can be tailored to your specific sales process, market, and business model. Whether you’re selling insurance, real estate, or any other product requiring phone prospecting, these automation triggers adapt to your unique workflow.Success in sales isn’t about working harder – it’s about working smarter. List rules ensure you’re always calling the right person at the right time with the right message, while automation handles the mundane tasks that don’t require your expertise.Ready to revolutionize your sales productivity? Start implementing these list rules today and watch your efficiency soar while your stress levels plummet. Your future self will thank you for the time saved and deals closed.Build your unique Mojo Dialer subscription today here. title: 5 Lead Management Tips to Optimize Sales in 2025
description: Transform your sales with 5 lead management tips from Mojo Dialer. Optimize follow-up and streamline your workflow in 2025.
content: Let’s be honest – every so often, we bump in to someone who just lays down, “I’m ready to talk.” They want to list their home, buy a new one, explore investment properties, or finally pull the trigger on that insurance policy.Those moments feel amazing, but they’re not consistent enough to build a thriving business. If you’re serious about scaling your real estate or sales career, inbound opportunities just won’t cut it. That’s where the Mojo Dialer and a bulletproof lead management strategy come into play.Whether you’re a seasoned pro or new to the game, the right Dialer, Lead Management and Action Plan tools can take your productivity, and your income – to the next level.Here are 5 lead management tips to keep your pipeline full and your follow-up sharp.1. Automate to Accelerate: The Death of Paper-Based SystemsSticky notes and scribbled legal pads might feel familiar, but they’re costing you deals. Manual lead tracking is outdated, inefficient, and risky. With the Mojo Power Dialer, all of your call data, notes, tags, and follow-up tasks are tracked automatically within our integrated lead manager – so nothing slips through the cracks.And when you connect this to Mojo Action Plans, your follow-up is always on point. You can assign call-backs, emails, and even AI-generated sales scripts with just a few clicks. That’s not just smart – it’s scalable.2. Reignite Cold Leads with Action PlansNot every lead is going to say “yes” today and that’s okay. The money is in the follow-up.Mojo Action Plans are your secret weapon for warming up cold leads without lifting a finger. Simply assign an Action Plan to leads that have gone quiet, and let Mojo take over the heavy lifting. Whether it’s a scheduled call-back, automated email, or a time-based reminder, your cold leads are always being nurtured behind the scenes.This is how top agents stay top of mind—and it’s a game changer.3. Clean House: Ditch the Dead WeightNot every number in your database deserves your time. One of the most underrated benefits of using Mojo Dialer with lead management is the ability to instantly flag and remove unqualified or dead leads.With customizable tags, smart filters, automatic list rules and disposition tracking, you can easily focus your time on leads that actually have potential – and shelve the rest. This creates a cleaner, more effective database and ensures your energy is spent where it matters most.4. Segment to Sell SmarterSales is all about timing – and relevance. With Mojo’s Real Estate Dialer, your data becomes a goldmine when it’s properly segmented.Create calling lists based on geography, lead type, last contact date, or any custom attribute in your data. Want to call only warm leads who haven’t been contacted in 30 days? Done. Want to launch a campaign focused on expired listings in your zip code? Easy.When you pair segmentation with Mojo Action Plans, you can automate a long-term strategy for each group of leads without second-guessing what to do next.5. Optimize Your Workflow with Mojo Lead StagesMojo makes it easy to visually track your pipeline with customizable lead stages we call Groups. Hot, Warm, Nurture, Cold, Dead – you name it – create your own.Instead of wasting time shuffling through notes or trying to remember who’s who, your leads are always categorized and ready to dial. Combine this with the Auto-Dialer to turbocharge your call volume and maintain consistent conversations with the right people, at the right time.Need to remove bad numbers? Mojo scrubs those for you automatically once you’ve marked them as bad. More calls, fewer mistakes, better results.Boost Sales and Productivity with These 5 Lead Management TipsManaging leads effectively isn’t optional, it’s essential. The Mojo Dialer, with integrated powerful lead management features and built-in Action Plans, gives you the tools to revive old leads, convert more conversations into appointments, and finally build the consistent sales pipeline you’ve been chasing.Ready to take your lead follow-up to the next level?Get started with Mojo and put these lead management tips into action today.
